intro: Senecio leptocaulos, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and small, yellowish flowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
